page.title: 03Yelden, Communications
page.content: There is a postal collection and delivery service twice a day in yelden throughout the week, once on a Saturday and none on a Sunday. At present the sorting office for Yelden is at Bedford but will eventually be at Milton Keynes. There are no newspapers delivered to the villages, but they can be ordered from the Court Estate Post Office. The residents have a rota of people who collect and deliver the Sunday papers. The Sunday Times costs 50p. There is a telephone call box in the village, the minimum cost of a call being 10p, but most homes have their own telephones.
